title.eng: How people saw a solar eclipse

utterances.translation: That happened a long, long time ago.
People in old days used to say that the sun got bitten off.

transcript.default: hayimḥickʷi ʔin wikuk ʔuḥ mamaɬn̓i qʷaa ʔaḥ nism̓aʔi ʔaḥʔaa hupaɬʔi ʔaḥʔaa sun hiɬʔaƛ ʔaminkšiʔaƛquu.

transcription.default: hayimḥickʷi ʔin wikuk ʔuḥ mamaɬn̓i qʷaa ʔaḥ nism̓aʔi ʔaḥʔaa hupaɬʔi ʔaḥʔaa sun hiɬʔaƛ ʔaminkšiʔaƛquu

utterances.translation: They didn’t know that it is not like that for white men: the earth, the moon and the sun meet up there.
It appears as if the earth bit off the sun.
They were really scared when it became dark.

transcript.default: tupʕaqƛ qii ʔuušyuuya ḥaaʔiʔat, ḥaaʔiʔatʔiš watqšiƛ. watqšiʔatʔiš waaʔat

transcription.default: tupʕaqƛ qii ʔuušyuuya ḥaaʔiʔat ḥaaʔiʔatʔiš watqšiƛ watqšiʔatʔiš waaʔat

utterances.translation: It was dark for a long time, it sometimes got completely dark — or “completely swallowed” they said.

transcript.default: hupaɬ wik̓iitšiʔaƛquu tum̓aqstuƛ, haa (maʔas) n̓iƛaak c̓iiqaaʔaƛquuč quuʔas c̓iiqaa.

transcription.default: hupaɬ wik̓iitšiʔaƛquu tum̓aqstuƛ haa maʔas n̓iƛaak c̓iiqaaʔaƛquuč quuʔas c̓iiqaa

utterances.translation: When the whole sun disappeared, it got dark and people got uproarious and they would sing songs.
Some people prayed for food and well-being.

transcript.default: waa ʔuukš tiičmis qʷaaqḥʔaaḥii čačimḥi hiɬ ʔaḥkuu nism̓aʔi.

transcription.default: waa ʔuukš tiičmis qʷaaqḥʔaaḥii čačimḥi hiɬ ʔaḥkuu nism̓aʔi

utterances.translation: And they prayed for their life and order on this land.

transcript.default: hayimḥi quuʔas qʷaaʔapii ḥaaɬ tuum̓aqstuuɬ, tum̓aqstuƛ.

transcription.default: hayimḥi quuʔas qʷaaʔapii ḥaaɬ tuum̓aqstuuɬ tum̓aqstuƛ

utterances.translation: People don’t know how it became dark for a short period of time.

transcript.default: qiiḥsn̓aak ʔuušyuuya ʔuuʔiʔat hupaɬʔi qʷaʔuuc qʷaaƛaa hupaɬʔi ƛaʔuu, yaaqʷiɬ mamaɬn̓i sun waa.

transcription.default: qiiḥsn̓aak ʔuušyuuya ʔuuʔiʔat hupaɬʔi qʷaʔuuc qʷaaƛaa hupaɬʔi ƛaʔuu yaaqʷiɬ mamaɬn̓i sun waa

utterances.translation: Every once in a long while the sun takes away (hides) the moon — the moon is also called “the other sun”.
[People used to think that] Son of Cod-in-the-Sky swallows both the moon and the sun.
They were very scared.

transcript.default: waa ʔuušckʷiiʔaɬ č̓apac ʔukʷiqsiƛ, hat̓iis, hat̓inʕaqa.

transcription.default: waa ʔuušckʷiiʔaɬ č̓apac ʔukʷiqsiƛ hat̓iis hat̓inʕaqa

utterances.translation: And some people got out on canoes and bathed themselves.
Now, I will talk about feasts and potlatches.
People never had a potlatch alone by themselves.
They would call and gather their relatives and say, “we would like to do it (hold a potlatch).”
Among them there would be the advisor.
They would ask him when it should be.
They think about how long it would take to gather various things to give away.
Now, when you give a potlatch, all the relatives would chip in.
They gather various things that they will give out.

transcript.default: ʔan ʔanackʷakʔaaɬ huuʔak n̓iƛy̓ak ḥay̓um, č̓apac, p̓ačiƛy̓ak.

transcription.default: ʔan ʔanackʷakʔaaɬ huuʔak n̓iƛy̓ak ḥay̓um č̓apac p̓ačiƛy̓ak

utterances.translation: A long time ago the only thing they had to give away were oars, bailers, and canoes.

transcript.default: hišumyiɬḥʔaƛ t̓apatšiƛ qʷiyucukʔitq, ʔuniccukukʔitqʔaɬ hišumy̓uup hihiqtup.

transcription.default: hišumyiɬḥʔaƛ t̓apatšiƛ qʷiyucukʔitq ʔuniccukukʔitqʔaɬ hišumy̓uup hihiqtup

utterances.translation: As they gather gifts, they think about when they should have the potlatch and how long it would take to gather everything together.

transcript.default: n̓aacsaatʔaaɬ ʔaḥ t̓ut̓učkiɬ k̓acḥaq ƛ̓iƛ̓ick̓uk, qʷiquusii.

transcription.default: n̓aacsaatʔaaɬ ʔaḥ t̓ut̓učkiɬ k̓acḥaq ƛ̓iƛ̓ick̓uk qʷiquusii

utterances.translation: You would see piles of blankets, flour or whatever.

transcript.default: ʔan ḥaaʔuuyiʔaaɬckʷatʔaaɬʔaɬ k̓acḥaq, hapumy̓amumʔak saštup ʔayiičiʔaƛukquu.

transcription.default: ʔan ḥaaʔuuyiʔaaɬckʷatʔaaɬʔaɬ k̓acḥaq hapumy̓amumʔak saštup ʔayiičiʔaƛukquu

utterances.translation: They could get animal furs exchanged for blankets when you get lots.
You would know when you get enough.
Sometimes he would give a potlatch just for the band members.
Sometimes you would invite other tribes.

transcript.Mod: wetkx hus naancaakamankx wetk hi hokmiqi.
transcript.Swad: wetkšˊ husˊ na·nča·kamankšˊ wetkˊ hi hokmiʔiˊ.

transcription.Mod: wetkx hus naancaakamankx wetk hi hokmiqi
transcription.Swad: wetkš hus na·nča·kamankš wetk hi hokmiʔi

utterances.translation: He left his brothers.

transcript.Mod: kun cuugx cuugx, xeenink hup hi nicwiqi.
transcript.Swad: kunˊ ču·gšˊ ču·gšˊ, še·nink hupˊ hi ničwiʔiˊ.

transcription.Mod: kun cuugx cuugx xeenink hup hi nicwiqi
transcription.Swad: kun ču·gš ču·gš še·nink hup hi ničwiʔi

utterances.translation: He went and went till he came to the edge of a pond.

transcript.Mod: wetkx we xeenink hi nicwinkix, weyk hi kixutiqi.
transcript.Swad: wetkšˊ we še·ninkˊ hi ničwinkišˊ, weykˊ hi kišutiʔiˊ.

transcription.Mod: wetkx we xeenink hi nicwinkix weyk hi kixutiqi
transcription.Swad: wetkš we še·nink hi ničwinkiš weyk hi kišutiʔi

utterances.translation: When he got to the edge of the pond, he swam it.

transcript.Mod: wetkx hesigen cuugx hi nicwiqi.
transcript.Swad: wetkšˊ hesigen ču·gšˊ hi ničwiʔiˊ.

transcription.Mod: wetkx hesigen cuugx hi nicwiqi
transcription.Swad: wetkš hesigen ču·gš hi ničwiʔi

utterances.translation: Then he went (on) again and came (again) to the edge (of a body of water).

transcript.Mod: tutk teetiqi, ha xeenix nencuu qati nenxwicuki.
transcript.Swad: tutkˊ te·tiʔiˊ, ha še·nišˊ nenču· ʔatiˊ nenšwičukiˊ.

transcription.Mod: tutk teetiqi ha xeenix nencuu qati nenxwicuki
transcription.Swad: tutk te·tiʔi ha še·niš nenču· ʔati nenšwičuki

utterances.translation: He said, “This pond is too big for me to cross”.

transcript.Mod: wetkx siksink his heectiqi.
transcript.Swad: wetkšˊ siksinkˊ his he·čtiʔiˊ.

transcription.Mod: wetkx siksink his heectiqi
transcription.Swad: wetkš siksink his he·čtiʔi

utterances.translation: Then an eagle met him.

transcript.Mod: we siksink ni wopmiqi, him haksigam ne, qamjaaxi sanki.
transcript.Swad: we siksinkˊ ni wopmiʔiˊ, him haksigam neˊ, ʔamǯa·šiˊ sankiˊ.

transcription.Swad: we siksink ni wopmiʔi him haksigam ne ʔamǯa·ši sanki

utterances.translation: The eagle asked, “You young man, what are you doing there?”

transcript.Mod: qixk kuu ketanki qap niigxiki.
transcript.Swad: ʔiškˊ ku· ketankiˊ ʔap ni·gšikiˊ.

transcription.Mod: qixk kuu ketanki qap niigxiki
transcription.Swad: ʔišk ku· ketanki ʔap ni·gšiki

utterances.translation: “I have come to the water’s side.

transcript.Mod: ha xeenix hi nencuu qati kixucuki.
transcript.Swad: ha še·nišˊ hi nenču· ʔatiˊ kišučukiˊ.

transcription.Mod: ha xeenix hi nencuu qati kixucuki
transcription.Swad: ha še·niš hi nenču· ʔati kišučuki

utterances.translation: This pond is too big for me to swim”.

transcript.Mod: nenxwi gihtkx te, kunugu we siksink hix ni wopmiqi.
transcript.Swad: nenšwi gihtkš teˋ, kunuguˊ we siksink hišˊ ni wopmiʔiˊ.

utterances.translation: “Do you want to cross it?”, that eagle asked.

transcript.Mod: tutk we siksi hi natmaqi, hi nenxwaga, teweex nencuu qati ha xeenix.

transcript.Mod: heecpicuk, gihcuux, we siksink hix hi teetiqi.
transcript.Swad: he·čpičukˊ, gihču·šˊ, we siksink hišˊ hi te·tiʔiˊ.

transcript.Mod: gihkite hikin, heecpi kaakwakicuux.

title: Trip to the end of the world
